content: ball of lion brand homespun 169 m / 185 yds to make one beret and approx one ball of loops and threads swirl pie worsted weight yarn doubled #4 459 m / 502 yds to make one beret  crochet hook 5 mm  stitch marker optional but recommended  scissors and needle to weave in ends notes  american crochet terms used  the pattern is written in continuous rounds i recommend using a stitch marker a safety pin will do to mark the first stitch of each row  the pattern is written based on the sizing information noted earlier but the pattern is easily adjusted to match whatever size you want  the pattern is written in three parts part one is the same no matter the size until you reach your chosen size/diameter part two depends on the chosen size and part three which is optional is the stem that traditionally tops a french beret  starting with round 1 i recommend placing a stitch marker in the first stitch to mark the beginning of the round then moving it to the beginning of each round abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet two stitches together decrease pattern part one all sizes start with a magic_ring chain 1 round 1 10 part two size small if the diameter of your hat is larger than you want at this point reduce the size by removing two rounds at a time e g remove rounds 14 and 13 remeasure after every two rounds until you reach the size you want then 1 single_crochet around and count the number of stitches to determine where to pick up in the second part of pattern if the diameter of your hat is too small at
